titles.title: Urging the President to expeditiously procure and provide three UH-60L Blackhawk utility helicopters to the Colombian National Police solely for the purpose of assisting the Colombian National Police to perform their responsibilities to reduce and eliminate the production of illicit drugs in Colombia and the trafficking of such illicit drugs, including the trafficking of drugs such as heroin and cocaine to the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Committee Agreed to Seek Consideration Under Suspension of the Rules, (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Gilman moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/30/1998--Passed House amended. Urges the President to: (1) expeditiously procure and provide to the Colombian National Police three UH-60L Blackhawk utility helicopters to assist them in performing their responsibilities to reduce and eliminate the production of illicit drugs in Colombia and the trafficking of such drugs; and (2) promptly inform the Congress, if the President determines that such procurement and transfer is inadequate to maintain such Police's operational feasibility and effectiveness, as to the appropriate number of additional helicopters for such Police so that amounts can be authorized for the procurement and transfer of such additional helicopters. Supports maintaining assistance for Bolivia at least at the level assumed in the President's FY 1998 budget submission and directs the administration to act accordingly.
